channel.title: Dumb > or = to Smart
channel.description: I've been thinking a lot of how our knowledge of the world and other things change our prospective on life. It seems that stupider people enjoy the false reality they are in, and oh how I wish I could be one of them. The true question on my mind is, is it worth it to lose all knowledge of this words short comings and be truly happy with your life, or is it better to be burdened by information and feel as you life slowly degrades. I've learned things over the past month while going over some documents that I wont say where I got them from because I don't encourage users of this site to engage in activity's of that nature and I find myself wishing I had never gotten them. An our cry to the public about the abominations hidden in these documents would quickly be silenced and I would no longer be safe in America. My decent into madness only furthered by reading some of these things. So what truly is [u]happy[/u], knowing all, or knowing nothing?

item.title: Dumb > or = to Smart
item.dc:creator: @Wet_Dreamss Wet Dreamss
item.description:
@Wet_Dreamss wrote:

dumb

Read full topic

item.title: Dumb > or = to Smart

@mod_taharok wrote:

ytuio9`:

What doesn’t kill you makes you stronger?

That’s it!

Now don’t ask me how it’s relatable.

Read full topic

item.title: Dumb > or = to Smart
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

I’d rather be smart and have knowledge of the things arround me than be ignorant to what’s really going on. I enjoy the feeling of being on of the smartest of people I know. Take one of the kids from my school as an example, I’m asked allot if I’m getting Skyrim or MW3, I’ll typically say both, then they immediately replay to me saying “Your fucking retarded, is soooooo much better.” without any prior knowledge to what I think/know. People that I’m forced to live with, including my own parents, are ignorant as fuck about everything and take irrational action without knowing anything about what their dealing with.

I know Humans aren’t perfect, but at least I look at who I’m aiming at before I pull the trigger.

Read full topic

item.title: Dumb > or = to Smart
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

What doesn’t kill you makes you stronger?

Read full topic

item.title: Dumb > or = to Smart
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:38, topic:423779”]But I could just as easily know what’s happening tomorrow and be happy about it, even if it may cause worry or depression to someone else.

For example, when people knew that WWII was one, I bet that Hitler wasn’t very happy about it. In fact you may say it caused him depression, knowing how he committed suicide soon there after Whereas in the Alliance there was celebration

Horrible example but yea…

So it’s more dependent on WHAT you know, not knowing in general I guess.[/quote]

Unless thinking about the Holocaust makes you happy, you incline to not think about it, as it makes you unhappy. This is the essence of ignorance being bliss. By not thinking about what makes us sad, that only leaves being happy. (which is a very flawed argument, don’t get me wrong)

To be honest, I don’t take much stock in ‘ignorance is bliss.’ I think it’s more effective to focus on what you DO think on, rather than what you do NOT. If you focus on happy things, regardless of your intelligence or knowledge, you’ll be happy. You could call this ignorance, but being happy and thinking about something depressing is not the same thing. (sorry philosophy)

I’ll throw this in for giggles, I consider emotions and knowledge completely separate. On monday I might be in a great mood and think about the Holocaust without any repercussions. After getting a bad grade on Tuesday, thinking about the Holocaust might just make me more depressed. It’s about influence and choosing to allow something to effect you (won’t even go into subconscious/unconscious choices), not what you know or do not know.

Now I will just be a plain bullshitter by iterating the old expression, what brings you down makes you stronger (or something like that).

Read full topic

item.title: Dumb > or = to Smart
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

But I could just as easily know what’s happening tomorrow and be happy about it, even if it may cause worry or depression to someone else.

For example, when people knew that WWII was one, I bet that Hitler wasn’t very happy about it. In fact you may say it caused him depression, knowing how he committed suicide soon there after Whereas in the Alliance there was celebration

Horrible example but yea…

So it’s more dependent on WHAT you know, not knowing in general I guess.

Read full topic

item.title: Dumb > or = to Smart
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:36, topic:423779”]That’s exactly what I was thinking when I first replied…[quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=526435.msg3834445#msg3834445 date=1322787960]It seems that stupider people enjoy the false reality they are in, and oh how I wish I could be one of them.
[/quote]

Ignorance is bliss, but that doesn’t mean knowing can’t be bliss also ;D (or not knowing, depressing)[/quote]

[arrogant-reply]But knowing leads to a deeper level of understanding which can be quite depressing (such as taking religion for face-value)[/arrogant-reply]

[non-arrogant-reply]People are happy and content when they don’t have to worry about the troubles of the world or know what’s going to happen tomorrow.[/non-arrogant-reply]

They follow similar parallels, one is just preferred over the other, in my mind.

Read full topic

item.title: Dumb > or = to Smart
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:31, topic:423779”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=526435.msg3835003#msg3835003 date=1322838257]
I fail to see how being depressed links to knowledge at all. It’s your own view on the subject (your own view on the ‘knowledge’ you have that makes you depressed), and it doesn’t make you smarter just because you only see the negatives of the situation. I’d say it was quite the opposite really, people that can have the same knowledge and be happy are a lot smarter.
[/quote]
You are switching my statements around, I’m not linking depression to knowledge, I’m linking large amounts of knowledge to depression.[/quote]What? That’s exactly what I replied to. They are not linked at all, it’s all about your interpretation and view on the knowledge. Though I’m glad you see it has nothing to do with ‘smarts’ or ‘stupidity’, so I suggest you change the topic and original post/poll ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Dumb > or = to Smart
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:27, topic:423779”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=526435.msg3834685#msg3834685 date=1322798495]

This thread is retarded. No offense but to assume that your reality is the real one and that makes you ‘smart’ and everyone that’s happy ‘dumb’ makes you more dumb than any of them

Well someones in a cranky mood today.
[/quote]Not cranky at all, that’s my opinion. Threads like this are just for stupid people that want to feel superior because they aren’t as happy[/quote]
You are looking at the thread in a wrong way, I’m not sitting here trying to say “ooo look at me, I’m smart and depressed”, yes I state that after acquiring some knowledge I have become more depressed because of it’s contents but the objective of this post was to ask the question would you rather know something like an impending death of all man kind, or be dumb or oblivious to the fact and be happy. The topic is about this catch 22, not about us whining about life, gotta be more optimistic David.

Read full topic

item.title: Dumb > or = to Smart
item.dc:creator: @Rixxx Rix_
item.description:
@Rixxx wrote:

[quote=“ytuio9`, post:23, topic:423779”][quote author=Rix_ link=topic=526435.msg3834825#msg3834825 date=1322811038]
I voted for “miserably smart”, so I’m going to correct mistakes everyone has made in their posts! My knowledge makes me miserable.

I’ve been thinking a lot ofon how our knowledge of the world and other things [size=18pt]changes[/size] our prospectiveperspective on life…

[/quote]
Grammar nazi fail!
inb4 but ytuio9`, I was waiting for someone to catch that!!!
But yeah I’d rather live as a caveman just because it would be a free world.[/quote]
Grammar nazi buster fail!
inb4 but Rix_, I was waiting for someone to catch that!

In this case, “knowledge” is the subject and it is singular. Therefore it is “changes” and not “change”.

item.description:

How about be smart enough to realize the good we have? I CAN read, I HAVE food, the world wont just end in December, or February, or any one magical day. Realize how many poor, weak, unintellectual people are in this world, then say you have it bad.
